intro: Warneckea bequaertii, commonly known as the African mahogany, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and small, fragrant white flowers. The tree produces small, round fruits that contain one or two seeds. It is valued for its hard, durable wood, which is used in furniture and construction. Warneckea bequaertii is also important in local ecosystems and traditional medicine.
